intro: Aloiampelos tenuior, commonly known as the slender leafed ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features small, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-gray in color, adapted to store water in arid environments. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the cooler months. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its low-growing habit and drought tolerance make it an attractive choice for xeriscaping.
